words.definition: An automobile is another word for a car.
words.example: The first automobiles were very slow compared to modern cars.

words.definition: A candidate is a person who is competing for a job or position.
words.example: There are three candidates running for mayor.

words.definition: If something is confidential, it is meant to be kept secret.
words.example: The companyâ€™s financial records are confidential.

words.definition: Corporate relates to a large business or corporation.
words.example: He works in the corporate headquarters of the bank.

words.definition: To enhance something is to improve its quality or value.
words.example: The new lights will enhance the beauty of the garden.

words.definition: An era is a long period of history with a particular feature.
words.example: The Victorian era was a time of great change in Britain.

words.definition: A guideline is a rule or instruction about how to do something.
words.example: The teacher gave us some guidelines for the essay.

words.definition: To incorporate is to include something as part of a whole.
words.example: The plan incorporates all of the students' suggestions.

words.definition: To interact is to communicate or work with someone else.
words.example: The children enjoyed interacting with the animals at the zoo.

words.definition: An interval is a period of time between two events.
words.example: There was a short interval between the two acts of the play.

words.definition: If something is mobile, it can be moved easily.
words.example: Mobile homes can be moved from one place to another.

words.definition: To modify something is to change it slightly.
words.example: He modified his car to make it go faster.

words.definition: Parallel lines are the same distance apart at every point.
words.example: The two roads run parallel to each other.

words.definition: A phenomenon is something that happens and is unusual.
words.example: The Northern Lights are a natural phenomenon.

words.definition: To pollute is to make air, water, or land dirty.
words.example: Factories can pollute the air with smoke.

words.definition: To ridicule is to make fun of someone in a mean way.
words.example: The other children ridiculed him for his old shoes.

words.definition: Solar relates to the sun.
words.example: Solar energy is a clean way to produce electricity.

words.definition: A territory is an area of land that belongs to a country.
words.example: The island is a territory of the United States.

words.definition: A tournament is a competition involving many players.
words.example: He won the local tennis tournament.

words.definition: Transportation is the activity of moving people or goods.
words.example: Public transportation is very efficient in this city.
